name: DeathMarkers
description: Online death collection for creators and players

share-deaths.name: Share my deaths
share-deaths.description: Contributes to the ecosystem of level creators trying to gain insight on their gameplay. <cg>Your deaths remain anonymous.</c> Visit the GitHub Repository for more information.

store-local.name: Show only local deaths
store-local.description: Store your deaths locally and only load them instead of the online collection. <cr>The mod does not store deaths locally if this is disabled.</c> This does not affect whether your deaths are submitted to the server.

normal-only.name: Show only Normal Mode deaths
normal-only.description: When rendering, disregards other's deaths that occurred in practice mode. <co>When using local deaths, this also does not store your deaths if you play in practice mode.</c>

always-show.name: Always show Markers in-game
always-show.description: Draws Markers in-game even while playing normally. May impede visibility and performance, you should not normally use this.

draw-in-practice.name: Markers in Practice
draw-in-practice.description: Whether to draw death markers in Practice Mode and Testmode.

newbest-only.name: Show Markers only on New Best
newbest-only.description: Whether to show death markers only when you achieve a new best percentage. Will show regardless in Platformer mode and if you have beaten the level before.

prog-bar-hist-height.name: Death histogram height
prog-bar-hist-height.description: Draws a Graph of the distribution of deaths by percentage beneath the progress bar upon death. 0 to disable

marker-scale.name: Marker Scale
marker-scale.description: Determines the scale of the markers, 0 to disable.

fade-time.name: Fade Time
fade-time.description: Determines how long it takes until all markers have entered their final position. (For reference, after dying, it takes 1 or 0.5 seconds for the screen to reset depending on your setting)

stacks-in-editor.name: Marker Stacks in Editor
stacks-in-editor.description: Whether to mark groups of death markers in close proximity with a special indicator. Causes lag with large amounts of markers in a level, but disambiguates deaths laying at the exact same coordiantes.

darken-editor.name: Darkener in Editor
darken-editor.description: How much the level should be darkened in the editor when markers are being shown. 0 = Full brightness, 255 = Blackout (not recommended)
